content: Anybody else notice that when upgrading a D7 site with Views that it doesn't respect the enabled/disabled status of the View?
Just noticed this with a client that had a tonne of disabled views that should have been deleted

Herb said:

Anybody else notice that when upgrading a D7 site with Views that it doesn't respect the enabled/disabled status of the View?

That sucks. We haven't done any upgrades, but instead do migrations because we're redo-ing the site at the same time, so I haven't run into that issue. That will be useful to know if we have to upgrade a client in the future.
@Herb Why should they have been deleted? Why not keeping disabled Views?
@Olaf Grabienski I meant disabled

I'm working on a dev site that is being upgraded from Drupal 7 and just noticed that I can't add new displays in any Views (even new Views I create at this point). Has anyone else see this happen? Screen-Shot-2021-02-01-at-12.31.59-PM.jpg
I rough chopped some CSS from the old site in a temporary module and it was hiding that button somehow...
